intro: Doniophyton flavescens, commonly known as the yellow-flowered doniophyton, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, erect stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow, with a distinctive central disc surrounded by ray florets. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas.
